sentences.sContent: Well, at least I can face them all with a clear conscience (= the knowledge that you have done nothing wrong ) .
sentences.sCn: 好吧，至少我可以问心无愧地面对他们所有人。

sentences.sContent: I can’t tell you what to do – it’s a matter of conscience (= something that you must make a moral judgment about ) .
sentences.sCn: 我不能告诉你怎么办——这是良心问题。

sentences.sContent: a crisis of conscience among medical staff (= a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what is the right thing to do )
sentences.sCn: 医务人员中的良心危机

remMethod.val: con ＋ science(科学) → 研究科学也要有道德心 → 良心， 道德心

words.tran: 认真的；尽责的；本着良心的；小心谨慎的

trans.tranOther: the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong
